result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Quinton Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges. To be paid by 6/3/2016.  As penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Quinton Love

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andre Quinton Love in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Andre Quinton Love in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for 61 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 06-03-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.00.
Defendant Andre Quinton Love in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.
Letter to Delicia Love regarding child care release.
Letter from mother of defendant's children asking that defendant be granted huber to care for his children.  Also, a letter from defendant's son asking that defendant be granted huber privileges.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Kmart at 3201 N Mayfair Rd
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Andre Quinton Love in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Andre Quinton Love in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andre Quinton Love
Current: 3365 N 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-11-2015)
Prior: 2320 North 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
